summary: Is a camp in Skyrims harshest Climate, the frozen tundra.
descriptionHtml:
I really, really like cheese.
[URL=http://s580.photobucket.com/user/Death811/media/200px-EidarCheeseWheel_zps2865cb1a.png.html][IMG]http://i580.photobucket.com/albums/ss242/Death811/200px-EidarCheeseWheel_zps2865cb1a.png[/IMG][/URL]

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AI6mM3an6n4#t=13
Thank ya' kindly NILLOC916. MightyBoosh <3

[b]❄NOW TES5EDIT CLEAN!❄[/b]

[b]❄RE UPLOADED❄[/b]
So some of you may be asking, Bill. Why did you delete the whole file and not just place this on "Hide Mod"? Well after having two helpful comments about this file needing to be cleaned with the Tes5Edit, I did just that. BUT! It seem'd that there was a more serious problem I oversaw, which is fixed now, thankfully! I didn't have to do any major changes. But to the point. I just decided to make a clean re upload again.

[b]❄INTRODUCTION❄[/b]
Frozen Mammoth Camp is something that I've been working on in my spare time. I always thought it'd be interesting to have a camp out in Skyrim's harshest and most unforgivable climate. So after a few cups of coffee, I'm proud to present the nexus with, Frozen Mammoth Camp.

[b]❄DESCRIPTION❄[/b]
Frozen Mammoth Camp is between Yngvild and a few steps away from The Tower Stone. It's map marker is also visible and fast traveled enabled. When you arrive you'll notice that it has a nice walled entrance with a gate. This it to keep out the tundras many unfriendly critters and folks that may try to pay you a visit. As you enter through the gate, you'll see that I have well placed crafting tables scattered about for the player to use as well as a few safe containers for the player to store his/her's items in. As you look about, you may notice that you can see Yngvild off in the distance, if you turn around, you'll see the beautiful Shrine of Azura. Erm, well... Her backside that is. But nonetheless a beautiful view!

[b]❄OUTSIDE CRAFTING TABLES❄[/b]
Smelter
Anvil
Armor Workbench
Sharpening Wheel
Alchemy Tabletop
Tanning Rack

[b]❄THE POORLY CONSTRUCTED HOVEL❄[/b]
Now, after your nipples are completely frozen hard, I suggest you hop in my horribly constructed hovel! Huzzuh! And a heads up to those who have/use followers, you'll have to keep them outside. I know, I know. I'm a horrible person because they'll freeze. BUT! If you've downloaded my other abodes, you'll know that I don't use followers so I don't bother navmeshing my interiors. Anyway! Once your inside it'll be slightly cramped. For some odd reason I believe I have a obsession for only making small, cramped interiors. So, with that out and in the air, let's continue! You'll also noticed I've cluttered and furnished the inside to attempt to make it feel cozy and warm. 90% of the clutter is decor, just for looks.

[b]❄FURNITURE❄[/b]
A comfortable, warm, snug bed.
Cooking Pot
Book Shelf
Dresser
Weapon Rack
Weapon Plaque
FoodSack
Shrine of Arkay
Chair&Table (It's slightly wonky, you'll see when you sit down. Though when in first person, it looks pretty awesome.)
Strongbox

[b]❄MODS I RECOMMEND TO HAVE A TRULY BRUTAL EXPERIENCE❄[/b]
[b]❄Frostfall❄[/b] http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/11163/?
[b] ☠Requiem ☠[/b] http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19281/?

[b]❄END❄[/b]
Thanks for downloading and trying, Frozen Mammoth Camp. If you enjoyed this abode feel free to show your support and endorse it. Also if you have a suggestion or a bug to report, place it in the comments selection or PM me and I'll reply as soon as possible.
author: BillNyeTheScienceGuy
